Package event

Class EventManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • event.EventManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class EventManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The EventManager class is responsible for handling event-related actions. events is a map that stores the names of events along with its associated event object. rooms is a list of all rooms.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private EventFactory eventFactory  
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​Event> events  
      private java.util.List<Room> rooms  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      EventManager()
      Constructs a new EventManager with an empty map of events and an empty list of rooms, when no ReaderWriter is provided

      • createNewEvent

        public Event createNewEvent​(java.lang.String eventType,
                            java.lang.String name,
                            java.time.LocalDateTime time,
                            java.lang.Integer duration,
                            int roomNumber,
                            int capacity,
                            int computers,
                            boolean projector,
                            int chairs,
                            int tables,
                            java.util.List<java.lang.String> creators,
                            boolean vip,
                            java.lang.String speaker,
                            java.util.List<java.lang.String> speakers,
                            java.lang.String tag)
        Creates a new event object.
        Parameters:
        eventType - The type of event
        name - Refers to the name of the event.
        time - Refers to the starting time of the event.
        duration - The Event Duration.
        roomNumber - Refers to the room number of this event.
        capacity - The room capacity.
        computers - Refers to the number of computers in the room.
        projector - Refers to whether or not the room has a projector.
        chairs - Refers to the number of chairs in the room.
        tables - Refers to the number of tables in the room.
        creators - The list of creators.
        vip - Refers to whether or not this event is VIP exclusive.
        speaker - Refers to the speaker username if this is a talk.
        speakers - Refers to the list of speakers if this is a panel.
        tag - Refers to the tag associated with the event.
        Returns:
        Returns the created event.

      • addEvent

        public boolean addEvent​(java.lang.String eventType,
                        java.lang.String name,
                        java.time.LocalDateTime time,
                        java.lang.Integer duration,
                        int roomNumber,
                        int capacity,
                        int computers,
                        boolean projector,
                        int chairs,
                        int tables,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> creators,
                        boolean vip,
                        java.lang.String speaker,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> speakers,
                        java.lang.String tag)
        Adds an event to the event list.
        Parameters:
        eventType - The type of event
        name - Refers to the name of the event.
        time - Refers to the starting time of the event.
        duration - The Event Duration.
        roomNumber - Refers to the room number of this event.
        capacity - The room capacity.
        computers - Refers to the number of computers in the room.
        projector - Refers to whether or not the room has a projector.
        chairs - Refers to the number of chairs in the room.
        tables - Refers to the number of tables in the room.
        creators - The list of creators.
        vip - Refers to whether or not the event is VIP exclusive.
        speaker - Refers to the speaker username if this is a talk.
        speakers - Refers to the list of speakers if this is a panel.
        tag - Refers to the category this event is in.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the event is successfully added. Otherwise, it returns false.
